title: Full-Stack .NET Developer
jobType: This is a Full time job
highlights: Dynamic role with scope for innovation & creativity
description: Permanent Full-stack IT developer role using a range of technologies to develop and maintain new innovative systems and features.
fullDescription:
The Opportunity:

We are looking for an experienced Full Stack .NET Developer to join our in-house development team. You will work collaboratively with, and report to, the IT Manager to facilitate ongoing innovative software development for The Southgate Group.

 

We’re a forward-thinking company that takes pride in the highly functional and user-friendly solutions that we develop for our staff and our clients. We have a proactive philosophy, which drives us to custom build our systems and strive for continuous improvement and development.

 

 

Your Responsibilities:
Front-end and back-end development;
Continued development and maintenance of .NET desktop applications and reporting solutions in C# & VB.NET;
Continued development and maintenance of web-based systems and applications and reporting solutions, including but not limited to:
the creation and maintenance of websites;
integration of database reporting functionality with web-based client portals;
the development and maintenance of mobile applications for iOS and android devices;
Assisting with the implementation and maintenance of APIs;
Assisting with the planning, execution, testing and documentation phases of system developments and updates;
Creation and maintenance of unit tests;
Documenting all technical details of your projects to ensure clarity and maintainability;
Implementing best practices for system design, coding, performance and security;
Collaborating with IT team members and other staff as necessary to ensure that solutions are purpose-driven, effective and user-friendly;
Handling internal support enquiries, software bugs and feature requests as assigned by the IT Manager / IT Helpdesk; and
Staying updated with the latest technologies and industry trends.

 

 

About You:

 

Essential skills you must have:

Minimum 3 years experience in developer role
Formal IT Qualification (or equivalent experience in role)
.NET Core / .NET 6+, C# (ideally also experienced with VB.NET)
JavaScript frontend frameworks (experience with desirable)
Visual Studio 2019 / 2022, Visual Studio Code
Microsoft Web API / REST Architecture
CI/CD Practices
SQL Server 2019 and later
Android/iOS/Xamarin/MAUI mobile development

 

Desired skills:

Azure DevOps/Git
Experience with Telerik suite of controls
Cloud architecture experience
Good understanding of computer security and cryptography
Experience with unit and automated testing frameworks
Blazor experience is a bonus

 

Your attributes:

Well organised with a detail-oriented mindset
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively (verbally and in writing)
Proven ability to produce clear and concise documentation as required
A positive attitude and willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies
Ability to work autonomously and manage your own task scheduling to meet deadlines
Strong problem-solving skills

 

 

 

About Us:

The Southgate Group is a leading provider of Fleet Management Services, Financial Services and Salary Packaging Services nationwide. Our core services are focused on creating better efficiencies within client organisations, to save them time and money.

 

At Southgate we look for talented and enthusiastic employees who will contribute their best skills and efforts, which is rewarded with excellent growth opportunities, employee benefits programs and fostering a fun and friendly team.

 

 

The Perks for You:

Working at Southgate, you will have access to our own Employee Benefits Program and more, including: 

A competitive salary
Access to salary packaging to save on Income Tax (with Novated Leasing and other lifestyle benefits)
Electric Vehicles via Novated Lease – Income Tax and FBT Free (including free onsite EV charging)
Access to amazing discounts on new cars and finance for yourself, family and friends.
Career progression opportunities
Professional development and training opportunities
Breakout areas including Cinema Room, Pool Table, Gaming, BBQ.
Staff incentives and rewards
Birthday day off
Regular staff activities
Casual Fridays
Free onsite parking
Modern offices in Port Melbourne (close to CBD)

 

 

If you have a passion for developing new innovative systems and enjoy working in a collaborative proactive environment, we would love to hear from you.

 

Please attach a Cover Letter to your application, clearly outlining your experience and suitability for the role based on the above criteria.

 

All applications should be submitted online via Seek.

 

Please Note:

All applications are strictly confidential. Only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

Unsolicited applications from recruitment agencies or third parties will not be accepted.
employerQuestions: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?
How many years' experience do you have as a Full Stack .Net Developer?
What are the 3 most important factors/attributes that you want from a new job?

title: Multiple Software Developers | Federal Government Opportunities
jobType: This is a Contract/Temp job
description: We are looking for multiple Software Developers as we are expecting multiple opportunities with our Federal Government Clients. If this is you, Apply!
fullDescription:
We specialise in connecting top software development talent with high-impact roles within federal government agencies. With our extensive network and deep understanding of the public sector, we offer unique contracting opportunities for Software Developers who are eager to contribute to projects that make a difference on a national scale.

Why Work With Us?

Exclusive Contracts: Access to a broad range of federal government projects that require cutting-edge software solutions.
Tailored Placement: We carefully match your skills, experience, and career goals with the most suitable opportunities.
Comprehensive Support: From onboarding to contract completion, our team provides full support to ensure your success.
Expected Opportunities:

Front-End Developers
Back-End Developers
Full-Stack Developers
Specialised Developers (e.g., Mobile, API, Cloud)
Key Responsibilities:
Front-End Developers:

Develop responsive and user-friendly interfaces using modern web technologies (e.g., HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Angular).
Collaborate with UX/UI designers to ensure high-quality user experiences.
Optimise applications for maximum speed and scalability.
Troubleshoot and resolve front-end issues across various devices and platforms.
Back-End Developers:

Design, develop, and maintain server-side logic, databases, and APIs.
Ensure the performance, security, and scalability of applications.
Collaborate with front-end developers to integrate user-facing elements with server-side logic.
Debug and resolve issues related to back-end systems.
Full-Stack Developers:

Develop and maintain both front-end and back-end components of web applications.
Work closely with stakeholders to define project requirements and deliver robust solutions.
Implement best practices in code quality, testing, and deployment.
Troubleshoot and optimise applications across the entire stack.
Specialised Developers:

Develop specialised software solutions, such as mobile apps, cloud-based systems, or API integrations.
Leverage expertise in specific technologies (e.g., Swift, Kotlin, AWS, Azure) to deliver tailored solutions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration and deployment.
Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry trends.
What We’re Looking For:
Front-End Developers:

Strong proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, Vue.js).
Experience with responsive design and cross-browser compatibility.
Familiarity with version control systems like Git.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Back-End Developers:

Proficiency in server-side languages (e.g., Java, Python, Node.js, C#).
Experience with databases (e.g., SQL, NoSQL) and RESTful APIs.
Knowledge of security best practices and server infrastructure.
Strong debugging and optimisation skills.
Full-Stack Developers:

Expertise in both front-end and back-end technologies.
Ability to manage the complete development lifecycle from concept to deployment.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure) and DevOps practices.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Specialised Developers:

Deep expertise in your specialised area (e.g., mobile development, cloud architecture, API development).
Experience with relevant tools and platforms (e.g., Swift for iOS, AWS Lambda, RESTful APIs).
Ability to deliver high-quality solutions that meet specific project requirements.
Proactive approach to staying current with technology trends.
General Requirements:

Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
Previous experience in federal government projects or large-scale software development is highly regarded.
Benefits of Contracting with Us:

Competitive Rates: Earn attractive daily rates based on your expertise and the role.
Career Advancement: Opportunities to work on a variety of challenging and impactful projects.
Trusted Recruitment Partner: Leverage our deep industry knowledge and commitment to your professional success.

title: Senior Software Engineer
jobType: This is a Full time job
highlights: Ranked #2 in The Australian Financial Review BOSS Best Places to Work!
Play a major role in the development of our platform!
description: Join Ofload and become part of a fast-growing technology leader reshaping Australia's logistics landscape working with PHP and React.
fullDescription:
About Ofload and our mission 

Join Ofload and become part of a fast-growing technology leader reshaping Australia's logistics landscape. Ranked #2 in The Australian Financial Review BOSS Best Places to Work List in the Transport and Construction category, we're not just a team; we're a community of mission-driven professionals dedicated to eliminating waste in road freight. 

Here, every day is an opportunity to collaborate with diverse experts, solve challenging problems, and make a tangible impact on the environment and the industry.

About the Role:

Our Engineering team is given trust and autonomy to do great work. We work in small teams focused on specific features of our core platform, with 4-5 Engineers including a Technical Lead. We work in a triad with Product Managers and Designers to solve problems for our customers. 

We are working with PHP8.2, Laravel 9, React.js, GraphQL and Node.js. It’s important that you have PHP/Laravel experience, however, you will also have the opportunity to work with Node.js. Our infrastructure is built on AWS, GitHub Actions, Kubernetes (EKS) and Docker.

What you’ll do:

Design and develop highly scalable, reliable, and fault-tolerant systems with PHP/Laravel and React.JS.
Translate business requirements into scalable technical solutions.
Take responsibility for multiple services maintained by the team.
Build and manage automated build/test/deployment environments.
Improve your code quality, product execution, and learning experience.
Plan and execute together with Backend, Mobile, DevOps, Data, UI/UX, QA.
Use DDD, Design patterns, and advanced Git to produce maintainable code.


Requirements:

Proven experience as a Senior Fullstack Engineer designing, developing, testing, deploying in PHP and React or Vue.
Passionate about Test Driven Development.
Experience working in a team.
Experience in software development or a serious open source track record.

At Ofload we prioritise impact, aptitude and passion, so we’d encourage you to apply if you do not meet all the above criteria.

Ofload: Drive Your Career Forward in a Community Committed to Innovation and Sustainability

Join Ofload and become part of a fast-growing technology leader reshaping Australia's logistics landscape. Ranked #2 in The Australian Financial Review BOSS Best Places to Work List in the Transport and Construction category, we're not just a team; we're a community of mission-driven professionals dedicated to eliminating waste in road freight.

Here, every day is an opportunity to collaborate with diverse experts, solve challenging problems, and make a tangible impact on the environment and the industry.

As an Ofload team member, you'll enjoy:

Ownership and Reward: Become a co-owner through our Employee Share Option Plan and celebrate shared success as our company grows.
Empowerment and Growth: Thrive in a fast-paced, supportive atmosphere that values innovation, learning, and personal growth. With opportunities to tackle significant industry challenges, you're empowered to achieve great things.
Flexibility and Wellbeing: Balance your life with hybrid work arrangements, including remote work options and additional leave for volunteering, celebrations, and personal milestones.
Community and Connection: Experience a family-like atmosphere where respect, support, and camaraderie are part of everyday life. Join us for team retreats, enjoy weekly team breakfasts and after-work drinks, and participate in a culture that celebrates diversity and open communication.

Join Ofload and be a part of a visionary company where your work drives real change, and your growth is limitless.
employerQuestions: Salary Expectation
At Ofload we work in a hybrid model. Are you comfortable working in our Sydney office (155 Clarence Street) every Monday, Wednesday and Friday?
Do you have full Australian working rights?
How did you hear about Ofload?

title: C# .Net Windows Application Software Developer - W.A Remote Role
jobType: This is a Full time job
description: The successful candidate will form a key part of the company's development team and has the chance to progress quickly in our growing business
fullDescription:
C# .Net Windows Application Software Developer (W.A Remote Role)

Emydex Technology is currently looking for a stand out Software Developer who embodies all our values of:

#Empowerment #YesMinded #Dependability #Excellence #Integrity #Teamwork

 

Please note, that this is not an open role for a Web Based Developer.  This job advertisement is for a Windows Form Application Developer.

We are an Irish Software Development company providing Software Solutions to over 100 leading Food & Meat Processing companies in Ireland, the UK, France, Namibia, Botswana, South Africa, North America, Australia and New Zealand.  


Too look a little further into our company profile and to see what we are all about, check out our:

Latest news and what we have been up too: https://www.emydex.com/news/
Facebook page here with some staff event photographs: https://www.facebook.com/Emydex-Technology-344547285589514/ 
LinkedIn Profile which helps show you what Emydex is all about: https://www.linkedin.com/company/emydex-technology

Our customers include some of the largest food processing companies in Ireland such as the Kerry Group, Kepak Group and Dawn Meats Group as well as the Dunbia Group and Moy Park in the UK, plus a number of high profile customers in Australia.

The Candidate:

The C# .Net Windows Application Software Developer should have all of the following skills and experience:

Food Processing Industry Knowledge (preferred)
Strong knowledge of Microsoft .NET technology
Proficient in C# language
Good understanding of object-oriented programming
Work experience in Microsoft SQL Server
Experience working with Windows Forms Application
Working knowledge of Azure DevOps
Exposure to DevExpress tools would be an advantage.
No Visa restrictions to travel (Travel may be required to certain customer sites)

Responsibilities: 

Design, develop and configure .Net applications in accordance with agreed customer requirement specifications.
Complete application design, code, unit test and integration test tasks to .Net development standards
Provide technical support where required.
Knowledge of Food Processing Industries would be advantageous but not necessary.
Communicate with clients, take ownership and resolve issues.

Emydex Working Environment: 

At Emydex, we value our employees and strive to create an engaging and enjoyable working environment that promotes personal growth while working with a leading-edge tool-set. This is a Telecommuting position in which the employee works from a home office. The employee will communicate with the team via telecommunication links, keeping in touch with co-workers and employers via Microsoft Teams and other internet communication tools. They will be required to occasionally travel to our corporate head office in Dublin, Ireland.  

Emydex Technology are an equal opportunity employer. 

Encouragement, guidance and support for those that want to self-improve and up-skill
Time in lieu for overtime worked
Flexible working hours (possible)
Extra days’ holiday per year of service
Finish Early Fridays
No meetings Wednesdays
Refer a friend scheme
Bonuses are negotiable based off achievement of KPI objectives

We provide the latest versions of all our tools including:

Visual Studio
Resharper
Redgate SQL Tools
DevExpress
Azure

title: Senior .Net Developer - ICT
jobType: This is a Contract/Temp job
highlights: Weekly payments and No agency fees
description: Exciting opportunity with State Government department in Brisbane CBD.
fullDescription:
Senior .NET Developer
About the Job

We are seeking a highly skilled Senior .NET Developer to join our dynamic team. You will be responsible for providing design, development, maintenance, and support services across various projects. This role involves working with multiple teams within the Information & Technologies Branch to deliver high-quality solutions.

Responsibilities
Design, develop, and maintain business information systems and application programming interfaces (APIs) throughout the software development lifecycle.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Application Environment, Database Operations, and Enterprise Integration Platform, to ensure seamless project delivery.
Perform system enhancements and migrations for various initiatives, such as SBS - TSS Reduction Data and SBS - Angular upgrade.
Utilize Microsoft technologies to reduce environmental complexity and improve system performance.
Review processes and suggest improvement opportunities to enhance overall efficiency.
Manage change requests and incidents using Service Now as part of the Change Management Processes.
Skills and Experience
Minimum five years of demonstrated experience in Microsoft ASP.NET/MVC software development.
Proficiency in Microsoft SQL Server (2012-2019) including SQL Azure, with strong skills in stored procedures, scripts, and performance optimization.
Extensive experience with Microsoft .NET (3.5 - 4.8.x and .NET Core) and Visual Studio 2019.
Knowledge of Microsoft Azure Services, Windows Server, PingFed, Azure DevOps, and Reporting Services 2016.
Strong programming skills in SQL and experience with XML Web services and APIs.
Ability to work in an Agile software development team and use DevOps for Agile development and delivery.

Apply now or contact Felipe Rabelo on 07 3291 5412 for more information.

Job Number: 263528

Diversity and inclusion are strongly supported at Peoplebank. People of all nationalities, gender identities, and cultural backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples, are encouraged to apply.

title: Full Stack .Net Developer
jobType: This is a Full time job
highlights: We need your C#/.NET experience to support the Stanwell Energy team
Hybrid work environment at modern CBD office
description: The primary purpose of this role is to drive continuous innovation in IT systems for Stanwell Energy.
fullDescription:
About Stanwell

Stanwell provides the spark for a bright future, and that future starts now. With our corporate office in Brisbane’s CBD and sites in the South Burnett and Rockhampton regions, we are a supplier of energy solutions to Queensland, the National Electricity Market, and large energy users throughout Australia. With more than 3 GW of renewable generation projects and firming capacity under development, we have an extensive renewable energy pipeline, with a goal of 9 to 10 GW of renewable energy and 5 GW of energy storage in place by 2035.

So, if you’d like to be part of the clean energy transformation in Queensland, working at Stanwell might be for you.

We care. We adapt. We deliver. These values are the driving force behind everything we do. And as we grow and deliver that pipeline of projects in the coming years, we will continue to serve our communities and deliver the power that Queensland needs.

About the role

This is a full-time permanent opportunity located in Brisbane CBD.

The primary purpose of this role is to drive continuous innovation in IT systems for Stanwell Energy (Stanwell’s retail division), enhancing existing legacy systems built on C#/.NET Framework with Durandal, and maintaining and developing newer systems running in Azure, using C#/.NET Core with Remix/React frontends.

The Full Stack .NET Developer will design, develop, and maintain both the front- and back-end components of these web applications, ensuring robust and scalable solutions. The role involves managing databases, integrating cloud services, and ensuring the security and performance of systems. 

Key activities include:

Perform maintenance and enhancements to existing systems written in C#/.NET, Durandal and Remix as directed by the Manager Technology, Innovation and Analytics.
Use Microsoft Azure DevOps to manage code and build and deploy pipelines.
Monitor on-premise and cloud applications for errors.
Suggest system improvements and work with stakeholders to implement these improvements.
Retail electricity industry is desirable but not essential.

About you

Development experience with specific expertise in C# and web technologies.
Experience with C#/.NET Core and Entity Framework.
Proficient with SQL (Structured Query Language) in SQL Server and Oracle databases.
Experience with React/Remix is desirable.
Ability to work directly with end-users and external stakeholders to deliver solutions.

Benefits:

12.75% employer contribution to superannuation
Access to Bright Spark – our rewards, recognition and discounts platform
Weekly pay
Contributions for IP/TPD insurance units 
Flexible work arrangements
Centrally located in Brisbane CBD
Incentive scheme
Health and wellbeing initiatives (e.g. skin checks, flu vaccines)
Access to learning and development on and off the job
Exceptional safety culture
Plus, a whole lot more!

What’s next?

To submit your application, please apply online with your CV.

Applications close: 11:55pm, 4 September 2024

Further information on Stanwell can be found online at www.stanwell.com

As part of the recruitment process, you may be required to undertake pre-employment checks (may include police checks, AusCheck, medical assessment and/or drug and alcohol testing). 

Inclusion and diversity are an important part of shaping Stanwell’s culture and how our workplace operates. We recognise and value that it’s essential to creating a safe, inclusive, and productive workplace.

We are proactive about giving our people opportunities to excel and truly be themselves. We enable this through diversity, fairness, and flexible work practices.

If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application.

title: APS6 - Java Developer, Traveller System Platforms Section
jobType: This is a Full time job
highlights: Work with a collaborative and caring team
description: We are seeking Java Developers at an APS6 level to fill positions in Traveller System Platforms Section within ICT Division.
fullDescription:
APS6 - Java Developer, Traveller System Platforms Section

Job Req ID

Home Affairs - 133757

 

Location

ACT 

 

Classification

APS Level 6 - $90,199.00 and $103,770.00 plus 15.4% super (part time pro-rata)

 

Employment Type

Ongoing (Permanent), Full-time 

 

Flexible work

Flexible arrangements considered 

 

Contact Officer

Bobbie-marree Barton on 0438 498 911 or Bobbie-marree.Barton@Homeaffairs.gov.au 

 




Applications close on 03/09/2024 at 11:59pm AEST (midnight) - Late applications will not be accepted.

 

About our opportunity

 

This process is being used to fill up to 3 immediate vacancies. A merit pool may be established and used to fill similar vacancies for up to 18 months. 

 

About our team

 

GM Technology & Major Cap Group | Major Capability | Traveller Cargo & Trade Systems | Traveller System Platforms Section

 

The Traveller System Platforms (TSPS) Section designs, develops, implements and maintains application solutions to enable travellers to safely cross Australian international Borders by leveraging industry supported technologies through well established strategic industry partnerships.

TSPS delivers high quality and accessible business services to our front-line workforce Australian Border Force and cross Government agencies through industry supported secure data sharing technologies. TSPS is progressing fit for purpose, industry supported technology capabilities to Simplify and Rationalise the Traveller ICT landscape.

Partnering with industry experts and both Business and Enterprise Architecture, TSPS are reducing technical risks to the Departments operational frontline services that secures the Australian Borders by delivering supported technology solutions aligned to Business and ICT Strategies. Specifically new Smart Gate Gen3 technology for passengers arriving into Australia by air.

 

Please visit our website for more information about the Department of Home Affairs or Australian Border Force

 

Our ideal candidate

 

The APS 6 Developer assists in the creation of user information solutions by developing, implementing, and maintaining Java based components and interfaces. The person in this job contributes to designs, and develops high-volume, low-latency applications for high performance and availability. One of the major tasks of the developer is to contribute to the entire development lifecycles, write well designed, testable and efficient code. A developer in this role must ensure that designs are in compliance to the business specifications.

The person in this job updates, maintains and adds functionality to an existing java software program. They should also:

Have excellent problem solving skills and the ability to diagnose issues in complex systems
Work collaboratively within a team environment, engaging effectively with business areas and other relevant internal and external stakeholders
Collaborate in real time across multiple platforms including but not limited to: MS Teams, AzDo tasks comments, documents, and video conferences
Participates in all aspects of agile software development, including design, implementation, and deployment
Engage with designers and front-end engineers, and collaborate with leading back-end engineers to create reliable APIs.

 

Duties and responsibilities

 

Developing, testing, debugging and diagnosing applications faults using programming languages within established testing protocols, guidelines and quality standards to ensure programs and applications perform to specification
Writing and maintaining program code to meet system requirements, system designs and technical specifications in accordance with quality accredited standards
Review code and technical documentation, to support knowledge transfer and accurate system documentation
Support, troubleshooting, root cause analysis and remediation of Production Systems
Participate in all aspects of agile software development, including design, implementation, and deployment
Under guidance building end-to-end systems optimised for speed and scale.

 

Additional information

 

The below is highly desirable for the position:

Qualification in information technology, computer science or software engineering or a related area, or equivalent experience or working towards qualification
Interest in learning new tools, languages, workflows, and philosophies
Professional certifications relevant to information technology.

 

Experience or exposure to any one or more of the following streams is desirable:

Azure DevOps (Boards, Repos, Pipelines)
ASP.NET/Html/CSS
Java
Spring
Struts with JSP (Java Server Pages)
Typescript/Angular/React
Source Control
Knowledge and experience in Ruby, Java/JRuby, React, and JavaScript
At least one year of experience in building large-scale software applications
Experience in building web applications
Experience in designing and integrating RESTful APIs
Excellent debugging and optimization skills
Experience in unit/integration testing.




How to apply

 

Submit your application and CV through the Home Affairs’ recruitment system (ourPeople) before the closing date on 03/09/2024 at 11:59pm (midnight) AEDT – Late applications will not be accepted.

 

As part of your application you will be required to prepare and submit a one-page applicant response document in relation to the advertised role, outlining:

How your skills, knowledge and experience relate to 'our ideal candidate' will be relevant to this role
Why you are interested in the role and what you can offer us
Any specific examples or achievements that demonstrate your ability to perform the role




Applicant response documents must be a minimum 11pt font in MSWord or PDF format, include your full name and the Requisition Number – 133757 in the document footer.

 

Prior to preparing your response it is recommended you review the Work Level standards relevant to the classification you are applying to. It may also be useful to refer to the Integrated Leadership Systems information relevant to the classification.

 

Eligibility

 

To be eligible for the position you must be an Australian Citizen.

 

The successful candidate will be required to obtain and maintain a Baseline Vetting (AGSVA) security clearance and an Employment Suitability Clearance (ESC).

 

Diversity and inclusion

 

The Department is committed to workforce diversity and applicants who are Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander, come from a diverse cultural or linguistic background or have a disability are encouraged to apply.

 

RecruitAbility applies to this vacancy. Under the RecruitAbility scheme you will be invited to participate in further assessment activity for the vacancy if you choose to apply under the scheme; declare you have a disability; and meet the minimum requirements for the job. For more information visit: https://www.apsc.gov.au/recruitability

 

Technical assistance

 

For technical enquiries please call or email for assistance:

 

Email: recruitment@homeaffairs.gov.au
Phone: 1300 793 883 (within Australia) or +61 2 6196 0444 (outside of Australia)

 

Please include any applicable screen captures, a response will be provided during business hours.

 

Notes

 

The Department of Home Affairs offers an attractive remuneration package, including salary, superannuation benefits and flexible working conditions appropriate to the level of the position.

 

The Department may provide relocation assistance to eligible APS employees required to relocate. The level of assistance will vary depending on the reason for relocating and your personal circumstances. For further information please enquire with the contact officer listed in the advertisement.

 

Information about employment and advice on how to apply for vacancies can be obtained from the Department’s website at https://www.homeaffairs.gov.au/about-us/careers

 

Candidates should be aware that in roles where vaccination against COVID-19 is required by public health orders/directions or other legislation proof of vaccination will be required. If a candidate is not fully vaccinated or is unwilling to be vaccinated within a reasonable time period, they may not be offered that role.

title: Analyst Programmer
jobType: This is a Full time job
description: Our members are at the heart of everything we do. Our vision is to deliver more than great health insurance, building healthier & happier communities.
fullDescription:
About Us

For 70 years CBHS Health Fund Ltd has been a trusted Private Health Insurer committed to providing exceptional value for its members. Our members are at the heart of everything we do, and we aim to develop a trusted relationship with our members as a healthcare partner and not just a health insurer.

About the Role

An opportunity exists for an Analyst Programmer to join our Information Services team based in Parramatta on a full-time basis. 

Reporting to the Development Team Manager, we are seeking an individual to Design, develop, and maintain technology solutions for the various CBHS work streams.

The focus of the role will include:

Actively participate and contribute to the software development lifecycle
Deliver high quality software projects 
Produce and maintain design specifications and technical architecture documentation 
Provide technical support 
Troubleshoot, debug, and diagnose system issues and propose solutions and remedies
Research and recommend industry best practices and tools
Maintain system documentation alive and up to date, as system changes occur

Responsibilities

Delivery of development services within estimated time frames
Proposing cost-effective and high quality development/technical solutions to the business
Design and build high quality software within estimated time frames
Maintain developed systems within a production environment
Develop and maintain system level documentation to reflect current state
Conduct peer to peer code reviews and provide constructive feedback
Provision of high quality software delivery to internal customers
Effectively communicate with various system users, both within and outside IS
Support the IS team and various areas of the business
Actively contribute to better development processes and methodologies
Maintain personal skills and knowledge, and share with the wider development team

 About you

To be considered for the role, you will, ideally have 

Completed a Computer Science degree or certification
Strong understanding of SOA, design patterns, OOP and TDD concepts
Experience with .NET (4.0+, core) development experience incorporating ASP.NET, C#.NET, ADO.NET, XML, Web Services (REST & SOAP), MVC, JavaScript, JQuery, Ajax
Thorough understanding of SQL with SQL Server (2014+), T-SQL and Stored Procedures development experience
Experience in Microsoft Azure technologies (functions, logic apps, API Management, etc.) (desirable)
Experience in Agile and Devops processes (desirable)
Experience with PowerBuilder (optional)

 What We Are Offering

An opportunity to thrive in a flexible and remote based working environment
Working with in an organisation with a first class culture and exceptional benefits
The tools to excel including a Surface Device and a full Work From Home setup
Organisationally support training and up skilling both internally and externally
An ever changing an evolving environment on the forefront of new technologies, modern practices and digital adoption
The opportunity to question, propose, change and create a lasting mark of success

Please apply with a cover letter outlining your suitability for the role and resume without delay!

title: APS5 - Java Developer, Traveller System Platforms Section
jobType: This is a Full time job
highlights: Work with a collaborative and caring team
description: We are seeking Java Developers at an APS5 level to fill positions in Traveller System Platforms Section within ICT Division.
fullDescription:
APS5 - Java Developer, Traveller System Platforms Section

Job Req ID

Home Affairs - 133758

 

Location

ACT 

 

Classification

APS Level 5 - $80,748.00 and $87,572.00 plus 15.4% super (part time pro-rata)

 

Employment Type

Ongoing (Permanent), Full-time 

 

Flexible work

Flexible arrangements considered 

 

Contact Officer

Bobbie-marree Barton on 0438 498 911 or Bobbie-marree.Barton@Homeaffairs.gov.au 

 




Applications close on 03/09/2024 at 11:59pm AEST (midnight) - Late applications will not be accepted.

 

About our opportunity

 

This process is being used to fill up to 3 immediate vacancies. A merit pool may be established and used to fill similar vacancies for up to 18 months. 

 

About our team

 

GM Technology & Major Cap Group | ICT Division | Traveller Cargo & Trade Systems | Traveller System Platforms Section

 

The Traveller System Platforms (TSPS) Section designs, develops, implements and maintains application solutions to enable travellers to safely cross Australian international Borders by leveraging industry supported technologies through well established strategic industry partnerships.

TSPS delivers high quality and accessible business services to our front-line workforce Australian Border Force and cross Government agencies through industry supported secure data sharing technologies. TSPS is progressing fit for purpose, industry supported technology capabilities to Simplify and Rationalise the Traveller ICT landscape.

Partnering with industry experts and both Business and Enterprise Architecture, TSPS are reducing technical risks to the Departments operational frontline services that secures the Australian Borders by delivering supported technology solutions aligned to Business and ICT Strategies. Specifically new Smart Gate Gen3 technology for passengers arriving into Australia by air.

 

Please visit our website for more information about the Department of Home Affairs or Australian Border Force

 

Our ideal candidate

 

The APS 5 Developer assists in the creation of user information solutions by developing, implementing, and maintaining Java based components and interfaces. The person in this job contributes to designs, and develops high-volume, low-latency applications for high performance and availability. One of the major tasks of the developer is to contribute to the entire development lifecycles, write well designed, testable and efficient code. A developer in this role must ensure that designs are in compliance to the business specifications.

The person in this job updates, maintains and adds functionality to an existing java software program. They should also:

Have excellent problem solving skills and the ability to diagnose issues in complex systems
Work collaboratively within a team environment, engaging effectively with business areas and other relevant internal and external stakeholders
Collaborate in real time across multiple platforms including but not limited to: MS Teams, AzDo tasks comments, documents, and video conferences
Participates in all aspects of agile software development, including design, implementation, and deployment
Engage with designers and front-end engineers, and collaborate with leading back-end engineers to create reliable APIs.

 

Duties and responsibilities

 

Developing, testing, debugging and diagnosing applications faults using programming languages within established testing protocols, guidelines and quality standards to ensure programs and applications perform to specification
Writing and maintaining program code to meet system requirements, system designs and technical specifications in accordance with quality accredited standards
Review code and technical documentation, to support knowledge transfer and accurate system documentation
Support, troubleshooting, root cause analysis and remediation of Production Systems
Participate in all aspects of agile software development, including design, implementation, and deployment
Under guidance building end-to-end systems optimised for speed and scale.

 

Additional information

 

The below is highly desirable for the position:

Qualification in information technology, computer science or software engineering or a related area, or equivalent experience or working towards qualification
Interest in learning new tools, languages, workflows, and philosophies
Professional certifications relevant to information technology.

 

Experience or exposure to any one or more of the following streams is desirable:

Azure DevOps (Boards, Repos, Pipelines)
ASP.NET/Html/CSS
Java
Spring
Struts with JSP (Java Server Pages)
Typescript/Angular/React
Source Control
Knowledge and experience in Ruby, Java/JRuby, React, and JavaScript
At least one year of experience in building large-scale software applications
Experience in building web applications
Experience in designing and integrating RESTful APIs
Excellent debugging and optimization skills
Experience in unit/integration testing.

 

How to apply

 

Submit your application and CV through the Home Affairs’ recruitment system (ourPeople) before the closing date on 03/09/2024 at 11:59pm (midnight) AEDT – Late applications will not be accepted.

 

As part of your application you will be required to prepare and submit a one-page applicant response document in relation to the advertised role, outlining:

How your skills, knowledge and experience relate to 'our ideal candidate' will be relevant to this role
Why you are interested in the role and what you can offer us
Any specific examples or achievements that demonstrate your ability to perform the role.
 

Applicant response documents must be a minimum 11pt font in MSWord or PDF format, include your full name and the Requisition Number – 133758 in the document footer.

 

Prior to preparing your response it is recommended you review the Work Level standards relevant to the classification you are applying to. It may also be useful to refer to the Integrated Leadership Systems information relevant to the classification.

 

Eligibility

 

To be eligible for the position you must be an Australian Citizen.

 

The successful candidate will be required to obtain and maintain a Baseline Vetting (AGSVA) security clearance and an Employment Suitability Clearance (ESC).

 

Diversity and inclusion

 

The Department is committed to workforce diversity and applicants who are Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander, come from a diverse cultural or linguistic background or have a disability are encouraged to apply.

 

RecruitAbility applies to this vacancy. Under the RecruitAbility scheme you will be invited to participate in further assessment activity for the vacancy if you choose to apply under the scheme; declare you have a disability; and meet the minimum requirements for the job. For more information visit: https://www.apsc.gov.au/recruitability

 

Technical assistance

 

For technical enquiries please call or email for assistance:

 

Email: recruitment@homeaffairs.gov.au
Phone: 1300 793 883 (within Australia) or +61 2 6196 0444 (outside of Australia)

 

Please include any applicable screen captures, a response will be provided during business hours.

 

Notes

 

The Department of Home Affairs offers an attractive remuneration package, including salary, superannuation benefits and flexible working conditions appropriate to the level of the position.

 

The Department may provide relocation assistance to eligible APS employees required to relocate. The level of assistance will vary depending on the reason for relocating and your personal circumstances. For further information please enquire with the contact officer listed in the advertisement.

 

Information about employment and advice on how to apply for vacancies can be obtained from the Department’s website at https://www.homeaffairs.gov.au/about-us/careers

 

Candidates should be aware that in roles where vaccination against COVID-19 is required by public health orders/directions or other legislation proof of vaccination will be required. If a candidate is not fully vaccinated or is unwilling to be vaccinated within a reasonable time period, they may not be offered that role.

title: Full Stack Engineer
jobType: This is a Full time job
description: The successful applicant can be based in Sydney or Melbourne.
fullDescription:
Capability and Experience

Proficient in full stack and backend development, including Node.js (20+), Java, Spring / Spring Boot, Python (3), Angular (16+), React
Extensive hands-on experience with AWS services such as CloudFormation, S3, Lambda, ECS, EKS, Glue ETL, API Gateway, IAM, SQS, SNS, Athena, DMS, DataSync
Skilled in both SQL and no-SQL databases
Familiarity with test automation and test-driven development, utilizing mutation testing, UI visual regression (UI Path, Cypress), functional testing (Jasmine, Karma, Cucumber), and mock frameworks (Mockito)
Expertise in designing and constructing REST APIs
Knowledge of DevOps practices, tools, and continuous delivery pipelines (Bamboo, GitHub, Jenkins, Maven, Bitbucket, Jira)
Experience applying Site Reliability Engineering principles, resiliency design patterns, and chaos engineering.
Familiarity with inner sourcing and promoting reuse principles and frameworks
Strong communication skills, capable of translating technical concepts into business terms within Agile environments
Self-starter with a Growth mindset, adept at navigating ambiguity and demonstrating learning agility
Ability to challenge the status quo and evaluate value delivery critically
Extensive experience in the financial services industry, particularly in funds management
Proficiency in web technologies

Role and responsibilities
Engage with business stakeholders and other team members to ensure solutions are aligned to business outcomes.
Bring structure to business requests, translate requirements into an analytical approach, and executes through to completion.
Work with the technical lead and the team to develop solutions, ensuring alignment to security and architectural standards.
Understand Vanguard's tools, technologies, applications, and processes.
Identify opportunities for continuous improvement.
Provide support to other team members in building skills and improving engineering practices

title: Software Developer
jobType: This is a Full time job
description: Seeking a highly skilled and experienced Mid Level Software Developer to join a dynamic technology team.
fullDescription:
Fixed term Contract rate: $100-123k + Super 
Location: Gold Coast
Contract duration: 9 months initially, likely to extend year on year

Position Overview:

As a Mid-Level Software Developer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining applications. You will work with a diverse set of technologies, including Python, React, Terraform, and PowerShell. Experience with Azure is a plus, but not essential. Your contributions will be key to building scalable, reliable, and high-performance solutions.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop and Maintain Applications: Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code using Python and React to build and enhance our applications.
Infrastructure as Code: Utilize Terraform to define and manage infrastructure, ensuring scalability and reliability of our services.
Automation Scripting: Create and maintain automation scripts using PowerShell to streamline operations and improve efficiency.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams including designers, product managers, and other developers to deliver high-quality solutions.
Problem Solving: Troubleshoot and resolve issues, ensuring the stability and performance of applications.
Code Reviews: Participate in code reviews and contribute to improving development standards and practices.
Qualifications:

Experience: 2-4 years of experience in software development with a focus on Python and React.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in Python, React, Terraform, and PowerShell.
Cloud Knowledge: Familiarity with Azure is a plus, but not required.
Problem-Solving: Strong analytical skills with a proven ability to troubleshoot and resolve complex issues.
Collaboration: Excellent communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to work effectively in a collaborative environment.
Adaptability: Ability to learn new technologies and adapt to changing requirements.
For more information please Apply Now or contact Sam Taylor - staylor@ampersand.com.au

title: Junior/Intermediate Developer
jobType: This is a Full time job
description: Come join us as we change the way Australians repair their vehicles.
fullDescription:
We are DingGo!

We are currently seeking a highly motivated Junior/Intermediate Developer to join our high energy team and contribute to our continued success that is disrupting the automotive repair industry.

Founded in 2018 and experiencing rapid growth, we are a tech platform that is transforming the smash repair industry through innovative technology and digitisation.

As an Accident management provider who works closely with Major Corporates, Government, Small business, Repairers and Insurance companies to achieve a customer first solution to repairing their vehicle, our geographical reach continues to expand, and we now need to take our business to the next level.

Come join us as we change the way Australians repair their vehicles.

 

About the Role:

As a Junior/Intermediate Developer, you will play a crucial role in the development of new features within our existing web stack, working alongside other senior developers. You will work directly with the business founders including the CTO who can help progress professional development and technical capabilities.

As a rapidly growing early-stage business you have the opportunity to shape the future direction of the role and even how the product evolves too.

 

What we are looking for:

Minimum of 2+ years work experience
Back End Development - Writing and maintaining program code in Generic LAMP stack (Linux/Apache/MySQL/PHP). More specifically CakePHP which is a PHP MVC Framework similar to Django. This includes researching, analysing, discussing, designing and then implementing the development requirements in the DingGo Platform.
Bug Fixing - Testing, diagnosing, and correcting errors and faults in the DingGo Platform to ensure features or functions are working to specification.
Knowledge of technologies - Staying on top of the latest technology and external systems in order to optimise any DingGo limitations in technology or processes
Documentation - Creating and maintaining appropriate technical documentation for features, functions, and processes
AWS Implementation - AWS Implementation with the following services Route 53 EC2 -> 2 instances one for staging and one for production. EFS -> 2 disks for backup and storage of all image files. RDS -> 2 databases . Version Control / Github

 

Life @ DingGo

Our offices are in Rhodes (which includes a free gym membership and access to swimming pool) and easy access to public transport
The ability to grow with the business and forge your future career in the company, with wide opportunities across different departments.
Flexible working arrangements
Monthly lunches in the corporate park as well as office socials, themed days and celebrations
You will live and breath our core values focused on care, value and ease

 

How to Apply:

Interested candidates should submit their resume and a cover letter outlining their relevant experience and explaining why they are a great fit for this position.

 

DingGo is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes candidates from all backgrounds to apply. We look forward to adding driven and enthusiastic individuals to our growing team!

title: Azure Migration Specialist - Application Migration Project
jobType: This is a Contract/Temp job
description: Senior Engineers required to migrate over 60 applications from a shared environment to a dedicated Azure platform,
fullDescription:
Azure Migration Specialist – Application Migration Project

Location: Canberra or Remote (within Australia)
Contract Duration: 6 months (with possible extensions)
Start Date: Within the next 2 weeks (ideal)
Security Clearance Mandatory: Must be Australian Citizen with Baseline/NV1/NV2
Rate: Up to $1100 p/d + GST

Overview:
We are partnering with a leading government agency which is embarking on a significant transformation project. The agency is migrating over 60 applications from a shared environment to a dedicated Azure platform, with the objective of achieving a 100% Azure environment by December 2024.

Project Scope:
This Application Migration Project involves a combination of lift-and-shift, functional uplift, and cloud-native modernisation approaches. The goal is to ensure seamless integration with Azure services while addressing the challenges of adapting DevOps pipelines, managing manual deployments, and overcoming integration complexities.

Key Responsibilities:

Migration Execution: Lead and execute the migration of applications to Azure, ensuring successful lift-and-shift, adapting DevOps pipelines, managing manual deployments, and integrating seamlessly with Azure services.
Azure Expertise: Provide expert support and maintenance for critical Azure components such as Azure B2C, APIM, and Front Door throughout the migration process.
Integration Management: Address integration challenges, particularly with external systems, leveraging available expertise and accelerators to ensure smooth connectivity and functionality in the new environment.
Essential Requirements:

Proven Azure Expertise: Strong experience in Azure services, particularly in Azure B2C, APIM, Front Door, and related components.
Application Migration Experience: Demonstrated experience in executing lift-and-shift migrations of Azure-based applications, with a focus on ensuring connectivity and functionality in a new environment.
Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to troubleshoot and resolve integration challenges, particularly in complex, multi-system environments.
Availability: Ready to start within the next 2 weeks and commit to a 6-month contract, with potential for extensions based on project needs.

How to Apply:
If you’re an Azure expert with a passion for cloud migrations and want to play a key role in a major transformation project, we’d love to hear from you. Please apply with your resume and specifically call out your application migration experience.

title: Application Developer (9812)
jobType: This is a Full time job
description: Join our innovative team as an Application Developer and work on cutting-edge projects that shape the future of technology.
fullDescription:
Employment status: Permanent Full-time
Classification: Municipal Officer Level 3
Agreement: Hobart City Council Enterprise Agreement 2021
Salary: $85,906 + 13% superannuation.

About the role

This role Supports the delivery of the City of Hobart's digital transformation projects through the technical development of business systems via industry standard platforms.

Key Responsibilities include:

Under the direction of a technical lead and project manager, work within a project team to assist in delivering solutions that meet end-user requirements.
Under supervision and direction:
­undertake technical development and testing of SharePoint Online, PowerPlatform and Azure Integration solutions in test/development environments;
promote approved developments and configurations to their production environment, including application update and patch management, using approved Change Management Protocols;
test, diagnose and resolve issues/defects/bugs; and
work with end users in designing and testing solutions.

 

Learn more about the role in the position description: Application Developer Position Description

About you

Join our innovative team as an Application Developer and work on cutting-edge projects that shape the future of technology. We are seeking a creative problem-solver with a passion for coding and a dedication to crafting seamless user experiences. 

Essential Qualifications

Bachelor Degree or higher in Information Technology.
Current Registration to Work with Vulnerable People. 
Current Driver Licence.

Essential Qualifications

Basic understanding of contemporary integration tools, standards and protocols such as REST, JSON, RAML, ODATA along with related technologies such as Azure Git Source Control, Azure DevOps.
Structured programming and debugging in python and C#.
Scrum task story board processes using Microsoft Azure DevOps.
Microsoft Azure deployment, navigation and debugging.Microsoft PowerAutomate and PowerApps.
Microsoft SharePoint Online, PowerPlatform and 365 platform administration.

 

You'll collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and deploy dynamic applications that meet our high standards of performance and reliability. At our company, you'll enjoy a vibrant work culture, opportunities for professional growth, and the opportunity to make a significant impact in a fast-paced, tech-driven environment. Apply now and take the next step in your career with us!

About us

The City of Hobart offers something for everyone, with connections between nature, history, culture, businesses and each other. We are proud to provide a range of services and facilities that support the wellbeing, safety and participation of the community as well as continuously look to improve and embrace new approaches to achieve better outcomes for all. With an industrious and diversified economy, wherever your skills, talents and passions lie, we can offer you the opportunity to have a rewarding career with ongoing learning and development opportunities.

We recognise contributions to our workforce and offer:

Above Award wages and Employer Superannuation at 12.5% with salary sacrifice options.
Flexible work arrangements including the option to apply for a nine-day fortnight.
A wide range of paid leave entitlements.
Health and Wellness programs, including onsite gyms.
Discounted membership at Hobart Aquatic Centre.
Ability to purchase additional leave after 12 months of service.
An Employee Assistance Program that offers onsite visits.
Corporate Health Plan discounts with BUPA, St. Lukes and Medibank.

Learn more about what the City of Hobart can offer you.

The City of Hobart is committed to building an inclusive community and workplace. As an equal opportunity employer, we encourage applications from people of all backgrounds, abilities, ages and identities.

City of Hobart has a strong commitment to health and safety. Appointment will be subject to satisfactory pre-employment background checks. These will include reference checks, National Police History record check, and Medical Assessment including drug and alcohol testing.

Learn more about our vision, mission and values.

How to apply

If you require any further information specific to this role please contact Phillip Monk, Business Intelligence Lead, on 03 6238 2802 or email phillip.monk@hobartcity.com.au.

All applications must be made in the online portal, and you can save your application as you progress through the stages until you submit your final application. If you have any issues with submitting your application, please email details of the issue to recruitment@hobartcity.com.au. Please note that we do not accept applications via email or after the position has closed so if you have issues submitting your application, please contact us prior to the closing time.

Applications close 11:59 pm Sunday 1 September 2024.

title: .Net Developer

description: Clicks IT Recruitment is working with a company within the technical agriculture sector.
fullDescription:
Clicks IT Recruitment is working with a company within the technical agriculture sector. They use applications and reporting systems to allow their key stakeholders to create sustainable practices.

The Role:

Permanent opportunity
Salary: $100,000 - $120,000 + Super
Location: Sunshine Coast

In this role, you will be part of a team developing and delivering information systems. You'll collaborate with stakeholders to build scalable software applications, implement features, and support existing technology. You'll work closely with business units to gather detailed requirements and enhance reporting systems. The role involves working with Blazor, Azure infrastructure, and blockchain technologies, where experience with blockchain will be a plus.

Collaborate with developers, UX designers, and analysts to implement technical designs.
Write and implement software according to specified requirements.
Maintain and upgrade existing software, improving codebases and conducting peer reviews.
Make performance-based recommendations for software improvements.
Provide written knowledge transfer materials to support team learning.
Liaise with colleagues to ensure smooth technical implementation and design.

Hold a bachelor's degree in computer science or engineering.
Possess at least 3 years of experience with C# and .NET.

title: Developer Programmer
company: Select Software R & D Pty Ltd
salary: Base Salary $74,000- $80,000 per year plus super
jobType: This is a Full time job
description: Select Software R & D Pty Ltd is a telecommunications company based in Sydney, Australia.
fullDescription:
Select Software R & D Pty Ltd is a telecommunications company based in Sydney, Australia. We are committed to the ongoing development of highly specialised Customer Care and Converged Billing solutions. Our team is growing, and we are currently seeking a skilled Developer Programmer to join us.

Position Overview:

We are looking for a Developer Programmer to developing high-quality applications, maintaining existing software systems, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver innovative solutions.The successful candidate will play a crucial role in designing, coding, and implementing software solutions that meet our business needs. 

Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain applications such as Service Desk and Selcomm using tools and languages including DevOps, Visual Studio Code, Visual Basic 2019, VB.NET, JavaScript, AngularJS, C#, and Stored Procedures.
Plan, design, and test intranet applications, ensuring seamless integration and functionality.
Utilise Visual Basic 2019 for efficient testing, debugging, and resolution of programming issues.
Trace and verify stored procedures using Putty to ensure optimal performance.
Conduct automated API testing with SoapUI or POSTMAN to validate requests and responses.
Collaborate with the Technical Director and development team to design and implement new features.
Develop stored procedures, integrate databases, and establish connections for APIs and web services.

Key Requirements:

Qualifications: A bachelor’s degree or higher qualification in IT
Experience: At least three years of relevant experience
Skills: Visual Studio Code, Visual Basic 2019, VB.NET, JavaScript, AngularJS, C#, and Stored Procedure.

title: Junior C++ Developer
jobType: This is a Full time job
description: Junior C++ dev role for a high powered graduate with a passion for learning and development.
fullDescription:
onQ Digital, established in 2012, is Australia’s leading provider of digital signage and software solutions. We specialize in providing state-of-the-art digital signage solutions that empower businesses to create engaging and dynamic visual displays. Our products include cutting-edge software, customizable hardware, and content management systems that make it easy to manage and distribute content across multiple locations and devices.

We're looking for a graduate C++ developer to join our growing software team to help us build a high performance, multi-platform, graphical application with various industry specific requirements. This role is best suited to a comp sci graduate with strong academic results or a new developer who can demonstrate high level skills using c++ to build applications. A detailed understanding of the C++ language, compilation and the fundamentals of operating system internals is a strict requirement.

This position is based in South Yarra, Melbourne and is a hybrid office/work from home role - we will only accept applicants living in Melbourne. The successful candidate must already have the right to work in Australia.

Requirements

Strong C++ coding skills 
Solid understanding of OS internals
Ability to write clean, clear documentation
Excellent communication and teamwork skills
Passion for learning and self-development

Nice to Have

Experience with C++ build tooling
Experience with OpenGL
Experience with Linux
Working knowledge of Git

Please provide an answer to the following questions with your application:

What is your preferred tooling for building C++ applications?
C++ is considered a 'cross-platform' language. In reality, what does this mean and what are its limitations?
What are some of the dangers of developing in the C++ language and how do you mitigate them?
What does great coding mean to you?
employerQuestions: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?
